page.title: 06Tourism in Kelso
page.content: Around{eight thousand visitors}come to {Kelso}every year. They come mainly for the{Border scenery,}the {historic {houses,}the{abbeys}and the{town } itself. Presently there are 6 hotels, 2 guest houses and a few houses doing bed and breakfast. The largest hotel is {Ednam House }on the banks of the Tweed. The other large hotel is the { {Cross Keys}in the Square which can provide annual accommodation for up to 10000 residents. There are 25 rooms containing 45 beds. The present cost for bed and breakfast varies between Â£14.50 and Â£35.00 per person a night. As well as reasons mentioned above, visitors also come for interests and events such as {Kelso Civic Week, Ram {Sales, fishing, Kelso Races, Raft Race and other attractions. A local {museum is also planned for the future.
